publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3649 Rob Gibson: Swiss Say No to GMOs—That the Parliament congratulates the voters of Switzerland who voted for a five-year moratorium against the planting of genetically modified crops in their country in a referendum on Sunday 27 November 2005; notes that the production of many Swiss farmers is organic and, by the nature of the agricultural land available to them, is on a small scale, and further welcomes the discerning views of Swiss consumers who prefer non-GMO food for their families, friends and visitors.Supported by: Roseanna Cunningham*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Sandra White*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Eleanor Scott*, Brian Adam*, Mr John Swinney*, Jim Mather*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-3649 Swiss Say No to GMOs (lodged on 29 November 2005) Bruce Crawford*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-3649 Rob Gibson: Swiss Say No to GMOs—That the Parliament congratulates the voters of Switzerland who voted for a five-year moratorium against the planting of genetically modified crops in their country in a referendum on Sunday 27 November 2005; notes that the production of many Swiss farmers is organic and, by the nature of the agricultural land available to them, is on a small scale, and further welcomes the discerning views of Swiss consumers who prefer non-GMO food for their families, friends and visitors. Supported by: Roseanna Cunningham, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Eleanor Scott, Brian Adam, Mr John Swinney, Jim Mather, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Fiona Hyslop, Chris Ballance*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-3649 Swiss Say No to GMOs (lodged on 29 November 2005) Shiona Baird*, Phil Gallie*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-3649 Swiss Say No to GMOs (lodged on 29 November 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3649 Swiss Say No to GMOs (lodged on 29 November 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3649 Swiss Say No to GMOs (lodged on 29 November 2005) Mark Ballard*
